dialogues.text: The Other Mother hates cats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like any "mother" I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? She's amazing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat climbs the tree's branches onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably think this world is a dream come true. But you're wrong. The Other Wybie told me so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nonsense. He can't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat looks at her, pitying her lack of intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps not to you. We cats, however, have far superior senses than humans and can see and smell, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the cat drops into a crouch and freezes, sensing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh! I hear something! Right ...over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SCRAMBLES across the roof and disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline shrugs, skeptical, and heads down to Spink and Forcible's, their door now circled with CHASER LIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes past elegant VELVET CURTAINS to discover an enormous, darkened THEATER with dim rows of seats and a high WOODEN STAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASHLIGHT comes towards her, carried by a black SCOTTIE DOG with button eyes. He looks up at her, sniffs, then leads her down the aisle past rows and rows of BUTTON-EYED SCOTTIES, to a front seat by the Other Wybie. She squeezes his arm hello, he looks back warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wybie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light flash, the audience quiets, then the curtains open on a SEASIDE SETTING with ROTATING WAVES. OTHER MISS SPINK rises up on stage left, in a MERMAID SUIT, large WIG, BUTTON EYES, and UKULELE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's practically naked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Miss Spink sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm known as the siren of all seven seas The breaker of hearts by the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flat cut-out ship manned by cut-out men rows in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if you go swimmin' With bow-legged women, I might steal your weak heart away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bows her head and the audience of dogs THUMP their tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spink is LOWERED through the stage floor, the SCENERY CHANGES, and on the right, a huge SCALLOP SHELL RISES up with the OTHER MISS FORCIBLE, clad in the bare minimum - her homage to Botticelli's BIRTH OF VENUS. She's facing the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper, to Wybie) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog HOWLS, alerting the near-blind lady, who turns to the audience and begins the next verse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big-bottomed sea witch may bob through the waves, And hope to lead sailors astray, But a true ocean goddess, Must fill out her bodice, (indicates her ample bosom) To present an alluring display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs thump and woof, Wybie and Coraline clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spink, furious at the greater reaction, gets back in the competition. Rising up, she makes it clear just who she's dissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beware of old oysters, too large in the chest, Let's banish them from the buffet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Forcible is up to the challenge - the scenery starts to change faster and faster as the ladies rise up and down, competing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm far more nutritious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell like the fishes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I hear a banshee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sea-green with envy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mermaid enchantress,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I "Birth of Venus!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set rigging can't take it anymore -- ropes snap, sandbags swing, scenery starts to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will send sailors swooning --oh--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will send sailors swooning --oh--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a crash, the old ladies TUMBLE DOWN IN A PILE. Coraline winces. The audience HOWLS with laughter as the curtains close on the disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRUM ROLL. A SCOTTIE DOG pushes a large BUCKET OF WATER, labeled "POOL", onto center stage. Spotlights tilt up to the top of very tall diving platforms WHERE THE OLD LADIES NOW STAND. Coraline can't stand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to break a leg, Miriam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our lives for the theater, April!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to bounce on the diving boards. As they bounce up, the two troupers unzip FAT SUIT DISGUISES from which emerge their YOUNGER BEAUTIFUL SELVES which LEAP to catch matching TRAPEZE BARS that swing into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline LAUGHS with relief and amazement, Other Wybie pleased. Dogs WOOF, MUSIC BEGINS and the TWO BEAUTIES В­ eyes BRIGHT BUTTONS, SEXY BATHING SUITS striped pink and green В­ SWING OUT over the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a piece of work is man! How noble in reason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They FLY past each other on their trapezes, double up, catch one another hand to ankle. We notice a LARGE PEARL RING on Forcible's finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How infinite in faculty! In form and moving how express and admirable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a SUDDEN change of direction, they SWING OUT over the audience, trapeze bar LOWERING and PULL CORALINE INTO THE AIR! She HOLLERS, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They expertly TOSS HER one to the other, FLIPPING AND SPINNING, as they continue their lines. Her SCREAMS become CRIES OF EXHILARATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In action like an angel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In apprehension how like a god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beauty of the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paragon of animals!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline swings face-to-face to the dogs in the royal box seats where one licks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The acrobats TOSS CORALINE UP into the air and JACK-KNIFE DIVE into the large bucket below. They rise up, unhurt, just in time to catch Coraline. The THREE BOW to THUNDEROUS THUMPING APPLAUSE and, as the camera pulls back on the scene, Other Wybie throws her a rose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Wybie escorts Coraline up the stone stairs from Spink and Forcible's apartment. The Other Mother and Other Father, a huge, full moon rising behind them, wait at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it wonderful, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Mother's hair looks absolutely beautiful and Other Father dapper. Coraline shakes with excitement as they walk toward the front porch. Other Wybie holds back, loses his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. They swooped down and pulled me right out of my seat В­ Spink and Forcible. Only they weren't old ladies, that was just a disguise. But then, I was flying through the air and... it was, it was magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do like it here, don't you, Coraline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, turns back) Uh-huh! Good night, Wybie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Father takes Coraline inside. Wybie, at the bottom of the steps, looks GUILTY AND SAD. Other Mother glares at him, makes a huge, false smile then points to him. He just lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could stay here forever... if you want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...we'll sing and play games, and Mother will cook your favorite meals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Mother rests her hand on Coraline's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one tiny little thing we need to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline is seated in her place. The Other Mother places a SMALL BOX with a bow in front of her, and takes her seat along with Other Father. Coraline excitedly removes the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you ... our little doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "surprise" is a spool of BLACK THREAD, a SILVER NEEDLE, and a pair of SHINY BLACK BUTTONS -- FOR CORALINE'S EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline GASPS. She looks up at her Other Parents, hoping it's a bad joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black is traditional, but if you'd prefer pink or vermillion or chartreuse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sees their button eyes changing colors, growing ever more panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... though you might make me jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO WAY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bats the box away, and her hands FLY to her face, COVER her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU'RE NOT SEWING BUTTONS IN MY EYES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but we need a yes ... if you want to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Father tests the needle on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sharp you won't feel a thi-- Oww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Mother KICKS him under the table. Embarrassed, he puts the needle back in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There now; it's your decision, darling. We only want what's best for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over and puts her hand, now ICY COLD, on Coraline's shoulder. Coraline PUSHES it away and STANDS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm going to bed! RIGHT NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline fights to control her quaking voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really, really tired. Yeah... (fakes huge yawn) I just need to sleep on things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Mother stands, masking disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well of course you do, darling... I'll be happy to tuck you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline backs away, urging them to stay where they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (palms out, forced smile) Oh, no thanks, uh, you-you've done so much already--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to leave and finds the Other Mother BLOCKING THE DOORWAY. Other Father joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. And I В­ (smiles to Other Father) we aren't worried at all, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon you'll see things our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets go. She and the Other Father herd Coraline across the hallway to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline carefully climbs the stairs, the Other Parents watching. When they can no longer see her, she RACES up the last steps and DASHES to her Other Bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline shuts the door and is quickly surrounded by fluttering DRAGONFLIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Coraline? Don't you want to play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps up and CATCHES the paper creatures, opens the TOY CHEST and tosses them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLUSH BLUE SQUID greets her from the shelf, followed by the TOY TANK GIRAFFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wanna hugga your face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a grip, soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GRABS them both and drops them in the toy chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her PHOTO FRIENDS - NOW WITH BLACK BUTTONS FOR EYES - call out from the photo by her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's yer buttons, yuper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna stay, don'tcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline grabs them as well, drops them in the chest, and SHUTS the lid. She barricades the door with a DRESSER and CHAIRS and then the TOY CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home tonight, robots - and I won't be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the bed, pulls off the blue boots then CLIMBS UNDER THE COVERS, pulling them over her head and holding tight. She HUGS herself to stop shaking, knowing she must fall asleep in this bed to wake up in her real bed at home. She closes her eyes and tells herself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses one way, then another. WE HEAR her voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep, go to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are strange, backwards sounds, then the eerie voices of Other Mother and Other Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just one tiny little thing we have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sharp you won't feel a thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon you'll see things our way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline fidgets and turns and turns again but sleep finally wraps her and takes her to oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Coraline's room, BRIGHTLY LIT LIKE MORNING IN THE REAL WORLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Coraline's face beneath the covers, as she's WOKEN by the light. With a hopeful look, she calls out, pulls back the covers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!... Dad!..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her smile turns to shock -- there's a BRIGHT, FULL MOON in her window and it's STILL NIGHTTIME IN THE OTHER WORLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I'm still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline races downstairs to the Other Living Room where the little door home must be! But the living room is LOCKED TIGHT. She pulls at the handles, plants a foot and tries with all her might! It's no use. She stops, panting, then hears a piano note being hit over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline opens the door and finds the Other Father sitting at the piano, his back to her, hitting the note. She speaks in her bravest voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you! Where's the Other Mother?     I want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Father turns around. He looks ill; his hair messed and his glasses askew. He speaks, his voice slowed down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All will be swell, soon as Mother's refreshed. Her strength is our strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITE-GLOVED HANDS POP OUT from the piano. One COVERS HIS MOUTH, the other WAGS A FINGER in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustn't talk when Mother's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you won't even talk to me, I'm gonna find the Other Wybie. He'll help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No point; he pulled a long face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PULLS DOWN the corners of his mouth impossibly far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Mother didn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PIANO HANDS pop out again, aggressively SHUT HIS MOUTH and SPIN HIM away from Coraline. Frightened, she runs to the door that leads outside, and pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs out the back porch, towards the Other Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses the trail, the Other House in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs down the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline runs past trees that are LUSH WITH GREEN LEAVES AND RIPE RED FRUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's panting hard, and has to slow to a fast walk. The further she goes, the LESS TREE-LIKE the fruit trees become.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the CAT MEROWWW. Surprised, she looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat trots along by her feet. She blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm gettin' outta here. That's what I'M doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky starts to BRIGHTEN and the apple trees become WIRE-THIN SHAPES OF TREES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Something's wrong. Shouldn't the old well be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remnants of the trees and the sky and the ground give way to a PALE, EMPTY NOTHINGNESS. No ground or shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing out here ... it's the empty part of this world. She only made what she knew would impress you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? Why does she want me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT (cont'd) She wants something to love, I think. Something that isn't her... Or maybe she'd just love something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat? That's ridiculous, mothers don't eat daughters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. How do you taste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHAPE RISES in front of them in the whiteness and becomes the beautiful OTHER HOUSE. Coraline and the cat slow, then the front yard and topiary, the sky, hills, white gravel drive and the poplar trees behind them FILL IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? But how can you walk away from something and still come back to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat curls its tail into a question mark, and tips its head to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk around the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline shivers. The cat suddenly TENSES, focuses on a shrub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bounds towards the shrub and chases out a CUTE KANGAROO MOUSE in uniform with a TINY TRUMPET. Before Coraline can blink, he's PINNED IT DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, he's one of the circus mice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a SWIFT BLOW of its paw, the cat KNOCKS the mouse into the air, and catches it in his mouth. He gives a QUICK, KILLING BITE - CORALINE GASPS - and the mouse TRANSFORMS into a BIG DEAD RAT. Coraline is stunned. He drops the rat on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like rats at the best of times, but this one was sounding an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat picks the rat up and heads off. Slack-jawed, Coraline speaks with admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gooooood kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline looks to the house with a determined look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the porch, she takes out a HEAVY CANE from the UMBRELLA STAND and hits it into her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, standing in front of the living room doors, TESTS the cane in her hands, and peers down the hall for danger. It's dead quiet -- no piano, no sounds of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She JAMS the cane through the doors' handles, and PULLS with all her might. One HANDLE AND LOCK BREAK and the door swings open into the pitch black living room. The hall light casts a narrow path directly to the Other Little Door on the far wall, cracked open. She steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge ARMOIRE BUG suddenly crab-steps in her path, blocking the little door, and all around her things start to glow. The room has been TRANSFORMED into an amazing BUG MUSEUM, with all sorts of glowing, living specimens in the place of the old furniture and furnishings. The radiators are now big caterpillars, the Nordic Track a serving bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Mother speaks out, startling Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say even the proudest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sofa, now a LARGE BUG, turns in place to reveal her sitting on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --spirit can be broken ... with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all smiles, button eyes shining, one hand held out in a behold my handiwork gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUG CHAIR scoops up Coraline and brings her to the Other Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Mother takes a candy dish from the servant bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, chocolate never hurts. Like one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She extends a CANDY DISH filled LIVING CHOCOLATE BEETLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're Cocoa Beetles from Zanzibar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline is disgusted. The Other Mother takes back the dish and BITES OFF THE HEAD OF ONE. It's the first thing she's eaten in the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be with my real mom and dad. I want you to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Mother FROWNS, swallows. She speaks with a FRIGHTENING STEELINESS in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that any way to talk to your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline is mad, and feeling mad makes her brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Mother STRAIGHTENS. Her button eyes, now DEAD, stare into Coraline's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apologize at once, Coraline!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline stares right back, not blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you to the count of three. One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she stands up, GROWING TALLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grows TALLER STILL and SCARIER like a super model on steroids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...THREE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This TALL OTHER MOTHER GRABS Coraline by her NOSE and DRAGS her to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, what are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She PULLS Coraline down the hallway to the mirror at the end. Coraline flails at the Tall Other Mother with her fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, that hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall Other Mother SHOVES Coraline RIGHT THROUGH THE MIRROR as if it was water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline HITS the ground hard. The Tall Other Mother, head thrust through the mirror, stares down at her angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may come out when you've learned to be a loving daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She PULLS HER HEAD OUT and leaves Coraline in DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline pounds on the mirror-door, kicks it with her blue boots. A SOB wells up in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we hear a SOFT GHOSTLY MOAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. She can just make out a sagging iron bed. When the voice speaks, there is a faint glow from beneath its stained cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush! And shush! For the Beldam might be listening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline steps towards the bed, the faint glow from under the covers in sync with the words she hears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ... you mean the Other Mother? ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently pulls back the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIMLY GLOWING GHOSTS of THREE CHILDREN, BUTTON EYES, SIT UP: a SWEET GIRL GHOST, Coraline's size; a TALL GIRL GHOST, emotional; a young BOY GHOST, very sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remember our names... But I `member my true mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy, dressed like Huck Finn, CONJURES up ghost flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strange-looking flowers wither and fade. He's so sad that Coraline takes his cold hand and squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you all here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghosts move about in a dance macabre, like ghostly fish in water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spied on our lives, through the little doll's eyes,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And saw that we weren't    happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she lured us away,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with treasures and treats,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and games to play!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave all that we asked -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yet we still wanted more -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we let her sew the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said that she loved us,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she locked us here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ate up our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghosts fall back into their bed and sink down. Coraline is stunned. She thinks a little and then speaks, trying to steady her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she can't keep me in the dark forever; not if she wants to win my life. Beating her is my only chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Then the Sweet Girl asks in her sing-song way:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps, if you do win your escape, you could find our eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has she taken those, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, miss. And hidden them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find our eyes, mistress, and our souls will be freed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghosts PULSE with hope. Coraline sits down against the mirror door, bounces her head against it. She's not hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, HANDS REACH THROUGH THE MIRROR and PULL HER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. of Coraline's FACE, eyes wild, as she TEARS at the hands that hold her. She GRABS one and, FLIPS her MASKED ATTACKER onto the ground. She pulls off his mask: it's the OTHER WYBIE, his mouth stitched into a PAINFUL, EAR TO EAR SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WYBIE?..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sits him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she do this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unstitches his painfully-huge grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope that feels bet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops her with a finger to her lips, and points to the Other Living Room, its door UNLOCKED AND OPEN. He grabs her hand and PULLS her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, the bug furniture asleep. They run to the big armoire bug that guards the little door and SHOVE IT out of the way. It CRASHES to the floor. And from upstairs, a voice calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline? Is that you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the little door. A COLD WIND blows from the dark passageway, now filled with SPIDER WEBS and the SHOES, COATS, AND HATS of other kids who tried to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel MOVES at the sound of her voice. Coraline takes Other Wybie's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. She'll hurt you again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head no, then pulls off his glove to reveal a HAND MADE OF SAWDUST. He blows his fingers away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH HEELS CLICK from the stairs; she's ALMOST THERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline? How dare you disobey your mother!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Wybie shoves Coraline into the tunnel and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunched down, she moves as quickly as she can, tearing through the sticky cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) Coraline!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strands of web brush her face, stick to her hair; she closes her eyes, hands out until she finally gets to the little door at the other end. She DIVES, TUCKS, --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- AND ROLLS OUT onto the REAL LIVING ROOM FLOOR. Coraline SLAMS the door shut and turns the sharp little key В­ still in the keyhole В­ to LOCK IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, covered in dust and cobwebs, and calls out with joy and relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M HOME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes quickly through the apartment, happily calling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody here? Hello, hello, hello! Real Dad ... Real Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mom's groceries!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are bags of groceries on the table, as if her mother had just gotten in. She pulls open a bag to peek and FRUIT FLIES shoot out. The food is spoiled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh. That's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door bell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs excitedly to the door and flings it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you guys so much-- You'll never--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's just Wybie, the real boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... the Wybie that talks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waves, face down, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Ha ha ha....yeah... Um, so you know tha-that old doll I gave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline tenses, sharp breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... my Gramma's real mad, says it was her sister's - the one that... disappeared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reads him like a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole that doll, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie answers quickly, guilty as heck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, i-it looked just like you. And I FIGURED--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, rushing the words, tells him the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It used to look like this pioneer girl; then Huck Finn junior; then it was this Little Rascals chick with all these ribbons, and braids, and....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trails off. Coraline studies Wybie, then, snaps her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma's missing sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, one brow raising up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just met her. C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him inside and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --drags him down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, listen, I-I-I'm really not supposed TO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline WALKS HIM to the LITTLE DOOR in the corner wall and points. Wybie looks around anxiously, fearful and curious to be in his grandmother's old house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, he bends down and reaches for the key in the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-can you В­ can you unlock it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand, stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in a million years. But it wouldn't matter; she can't escape without her eyes. None of the ghosts can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie stares at her, nodding his head as if he understands her crazy story. He changes the subject, gets back to his mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huhhhhhh... So, uh, I really need to get that doll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline snaps at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! I'd love to get rid of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exhales in a huff. Grabs his sleeve, leads him from room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doll's not on the bed, not on the chairs or moving boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you hiding, you little monster?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie nervously watches Coraline pull out her dresser drawers, yank cushions off the window seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Gramma been talking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doll's her spy! It's how she watches you, finds out what's wrong with your life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie, trapped like a deer-in-the-headlights, tries to make sense of her remarks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doll...is my Gramma's...spy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! - the Other Mother! She's got this whole world where everything's better - the food, the garden, the-- (leans in on him) --neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holds her hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's all a trap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie, eager to escape, cups hand to ear by the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Uh, I think I heard someone calling me, Jonesy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sees right through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't believe me?... You can ask the cat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves around her towards the door, turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat... I-I'll just tell Gramma that you couldn't find the doll-- OW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue boot - thrown by Coraline - HITS his arm. He turns back as she takes off the second one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not LISTENING TO ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ... cause ... you're CRAZY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FLEES as the second boot flies past. Coraline GROWLS, and gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her boots from the floor, and CHASES him down the stairs in her socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door flies open and Wybie RUNS down the front steps to his electric bike. Coraline RACES down after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You creep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling over his shoulder) Crazy!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RUNS his bike towards the FALLEN TREE, HOPS ON and PEDALS LIKE MAD. As Coraline hurls a boot at him, he GUNS the motor and escapes down a side path past the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy?... You're the jerk-wad that gave me the doll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of breath, she turns away and notices her PARENTS' CAR parked to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!   Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited, she hops over the fallen tree and runs to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, standing in the rain, excitedly looks through the car's window. But the car is EMPTY. She spots her mom's PHONE, then opens the door to grabs it and speed dial a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick it up, Dad, pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!   Whe-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm digging in my garden right now, but leave a message and I'll get right back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dejectedly looks at the phone, then snaps it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Spink is knitting a SWEATER WITH WINGS for a worried looking ANGUS, one of the Scotties, who sits on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sips tea, anxious, the other two DOGS beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... don't you only make wings for the ... dead ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just looking ahead dear... Angus hasn't been feeling very well of late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April? Aren't you getting ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks off camera) We've lost our ride, Miriam. Caroline says her parents have vanished, quite completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Miss Forcible, tightening her elaborate corset behind a screen, using pulleys and hooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! We've waited months for those tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the corset hooks FLIES UP and pulls off her wig. She ignores it and comes over to address Spink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we could walk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your gamy legs? It's nearly two miles to the theater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline CLEARS HER THROAT, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, oh yes ... your missing parents. We know just what you need. Miriam, get...that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Forcible grabs another dish of old stuck-together candy and puts it in front of Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is hundred-year-old candy going to HELP--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Spink suddenly RAISES her KNITTING NEEDLES as if to STAB CORALINE. Coraline yelps, hands up in defense. But it's CANDIES she attacks, sending sticky chips flying, making loud grunts as she stabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a LARGE, THREE-SIDED CANDY WITH A HOLE IT from the rubble and passes it to Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, sweety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline studies the odd candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds it up, looks through its hole at the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well,it might help. They're good for bad things, sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're good for lost things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't look any different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad things, Miriam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost things, April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline can't take anymore. She gets up, takes the odd piece of candy and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, dressed for bed with her blanket over her shoulder, walks into her parent's room, the PHOTO of her and her parents at the Bear Fountain in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls down the bed covers and builds COPIES of her parents out of pillows. She fits an extra neck brace on one pillow head and some reading glasses on the other. Then Coraline lies down and pulls up the covers, very sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-night, Mom. Good-night, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses them both and BEGINS TO CRY. CAM PUSHES IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, asleep. SOMETHING blurs past camera. One paw and then two paws bat her nose. She opens her eyes to find OPAL BLUE EYES staring at her. It's the BLACK CAT, purring loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. How did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat yawns, his eyes flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where Mom and Dad are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat blinks. Then he heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows him, wrapped in her blanket, to the MIRROR at the end of the hallway. The mirror starts to GLOW and then an IMAGE FORMS within the glass. It's HER PARENTS! They cling together, blue with cold, as snow falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM! DAD!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up and, with a desperate look, Mel BREATHES on the inside mirror-glass to fog it. She writes H E L P U S. В­ her fingertip squeaking on the glass like a SMALL, SAD BIRD. Frost RISES UP, hiding the letters and then her parents. The image fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline STRIKES AT THE MIRROR as hard as she can. GLASS SHATTERS and she drops to the ground, shaking. The cat nuzzles her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From under the bed, the cat drags out the BUTTON-EYED DOLL, REMADE into HER MOTHER on one side, and HER FATHER on the other!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's taken them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, enraged, THROWS the doll. FIRE LIGHT comes up on her face as the background DISSOLVES TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON DOLL: BURNING in the FIREPLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline and cat watch until the fire burns out. She takes a breath and looks up at the mantel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON snowglobe, the one of the FOUNTAIN BEARS from the Detroit Zoo. Coraline cradles it, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not coming back, are they В­ Mom and Dad. Not on their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat blinks. She looks over at the locked little door in the corner wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Series of quick shots of Coraline getting ready to go. Pulls her collecting bag from the closet, her puffy vest, her boots; grabs a candle and garden shears, puts them in the bag. She stands to go, taking her cap off the chair. The ODD PIECE OF CANDY, the triangle green one with the hole, drops to the floor. She hesitates a moment, then sticks it in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the click of the door being unlocked. It opens to reveal the cat, and - holding a lit candle - Coraline. She leaves the key in the lock, like always, takes a breath and crawls forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The candle casts huge, flickering shadows along the wall. The cat, his voice returned, SPEAKS to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're walking right into her trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great feeling, she explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challenge her then. She may not play fair but she won't refuse. She's got a thing for games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline thinks about it, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door at the end of the tunnel clicks open, the candle BLOWS OUT and the cat VANISHES IN THE DARK. Coraline tenses when a voice calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, framed in the open door, back-lit in blue, Coraline's REAL MOTHER, with neck brace and dressed in her shopping clothes, calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, you came back for us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs forward eagerly and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --out the Other Little Door, throwing her arms out to hug her real Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling! (voice shifting) Why would you run away from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sees her mother's hand GROW as it wraps around her. Alarmed, she PUSHES AWAY and sees the DECOY MOM grow into the TALL OTHER MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room LIGHTS UP with the glowing bug furniture and a fireplace fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline tries her best to be brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Other Mother's button eyes GLITTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, I have no idea where your "old" parents are. Perhaps they've grown bored of you and run away to France?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her teeth gleam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't bored of me.   You stole them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Father, a FOOT SHORTER than before, his sagging face a pale PUMPKIN color, his hair VINES, comes up behind Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, don't be difficult, Coraline. Have a seat, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Father, GURGLING happily, herds Coraline onto the walking bug chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Other Mother, standing by the little door, turns to it and CLAPS her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, a HUGE RAT skitters out of the tunnel - FILLED AGAIN with spider webs and children's things - carrying the KEY from the real world door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Other Mother takes the key, locks the door, and while the armoire bug assumes guard position - she SWALLOWS THE KEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you have your own key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Mother PULLS A VINE growing from his ear, SHUTTING HIS MOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garden squash need tending, don't you think, pumpkin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns him around, her hands under his arms and drags him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squish squash, pumpkin sauce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, Coraline hears the very faint SOUND OF A FINGER ON GLASS, just like when her mother wrote HELP on the mirror. Coraline jumps to her feet, looking around the room for a sign of her real parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Mom, Dad, where'd she hide you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muffled screen door slams O.S. and the Tall Other Mother calls to her from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast-time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline leaves frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline pauses in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Be strong, Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits at the kitchen table in her regular place, her back to the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall Other Mother, humming happily, prepares a mushroom omelet and bacon. Fragrant cinnamon buns bake in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the table's center, Coraline sees the box with her BUTTON EYES with needle and thread. A bead of sweat rolls down her forehead. As casually as she can, she asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious, trying to be cool) Why don't we play ... a game? I know you like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Other Mother's button eyes FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody likes games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bacon sizzles and spits on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of game would it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exploring game ... a finding things game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Mother tries to act disinterested, but her fingers drum with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is it you'd be finding, Coraline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My real parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She folds the omelet over in the pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, and the eyes of the ghost children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall Other Mother smiles: now it's getting interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meal ready, she turns from the stove and takes the food to Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you don't find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I lose, I'll stay here with you forever and let you love me. (indicates button box) And I'll let you sew buttons into my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... And if you somehow win this game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you let me go. You let everyone go В­ my real father and mother, the dead children, everyone you've trapped here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Other Mother smiles a malicious not in a million years smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out her hand. Coraline doesn't reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not till you give me a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall Other Mother snorts, her smile sours. She slowly circles Coraline, and speaks as if talking to a very stupid child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right... In each of three wonders I've made just for you, a ghost's eye is lost in plain sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for my parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall Other Mother - standing behind her in front of the sink - smiles wickedly and just starts TAPPING HER BUTTON EYE with her finger nail. Coraline turns away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Don't tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extending her hand, Coraline starts to turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's a deal--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Tall Other Mother HAS DISAPPEARED and the tapping now is the FAUCET DRIPPING in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline EXHALES, walks to the sink, stares at the dripping faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she mean "wonders?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the kitchen window, the FANTASTIC GARDEN LIGHTS UP, answering her question. She FURROWS HER BROWS, thinks this was too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline walks through the gates. The bright magic of the garden is DARKER NOW, with areas of black against areas of glowing flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes the PITCHER PLANTS, and the one with the frog suddenly SWALLOWS the animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes up the steps past the BLEEDING HEARTS, which now LEAK STICKY RED JUICE that runs down the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top, a few SNAPDRAGONS, feeble now, SNAP at her. She KICKS them down. Behind her, a brick tree ring OPENS like a monster's MOUTH and five HUGE, PALE SNAPDRAGONS sneak towards her. They ATTACK, knock her to the ground, spilling her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They GRAB CORALINE at her ankles, knees, hips, waist, and shoulder, and start to ROLL HER UP TOWARDS THE STONE MOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline is just able to GRAB her GARDEN SHEARS. She CUTS OFF one mutant snapdragon's head, then another, until she is free. The HEADLESS STEMS retreat into the rock mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, winded, goes to gather her spilled things when a trio of HUMMINGBIRDS/WASP HYBRIDS SWOOP IN. They don't attack her; instead they poke their long beaks into the TRIANGLE CANDY WITH THE HOLE and LIFT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline chases them, but they're getting away. As she crosses the little bridge, she takes off her cap and FLINGS IT LIKE A FRISBEE at them. SCORE! They fall to the ground, near the eyebrow shrubs, sawdust spilling out. She picks up the triangle candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why steal this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a look of what does she have to lose, she holds it up to her eye and GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYTHING IS BLURRY GREY like a pencil drawing, all color gone. She scans the garden, turning slowly. As she turns back to where she started, she sees something, right in front of her: a BURNING RED EMBER -- A GHOST'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lowers the stone from her eye, to see that the ghost's eye is the FADED STICK SHIFT KNOB from the preying mantis tractor, which STANDS RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER with the Other Father, a SQUAT PUMPKIN MAN, at its controls, his own hands IMPRISONED IN THE MECHANICAL PIANO HANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADLIGHTS GLARE and the tractor ROARS TO LIFE. The mechanical hands FORCE Other Father to SHIFT GEARS, and the tractor LURCHES at Coraline, its arms SLASHING. She yells, backs away. Other Father calls in a garbled voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrry, so sorrry, Motherrr making meeee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline backs onto the little bridge that spans the fountains as the tractor moves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't waaaanno hurrrrrt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Father tries to steer the tractor away, but the mechanical hands are stronger. It moves onto the bridge - STUPIDLY SMASHING THROUGH THE PLANKS in front of it. Halfway over, it lurches, then STARTS TO FALL THROUGH THE HOLE IT HAS CREATED. The tractor hangs precariously for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Father KICKS away one mechanical hand, and with ONE HAND FREE, manages to PULL OFF THE SHIFT KNOB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taaaake it!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline DIVES FORWARD and just GETS THE KNOB before the tractor and Other Father fall away and SINK UNDER THE WATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rippling out from Coraline like a gray wave, the entire GARDEN BECOMES ASHEN AND DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline CATCHES HER BREATH, shaken. The ghost eye/gear knob GLOWS RED, no magic candy necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless you, miss, you found me! But there's two eyes still lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm getting the hang of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline looks past the greyed garden towards the Other House. A LUNAR ECLIPSE has begun, the full moon a pale acid green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline looks concerned, then resolved, and then she heads towards the house. A haunting version of Spink and Forcible's show song starts to play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORALINE'S POV DOWN STAIRWAY: chaser lights circle the door at half-speed. Haunting show song continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE ON Coraline. She carefully descends towards CAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE her flickering shadow and then Coraline appears behind the entry curtains. She steps close, pulls the curtain open. Song stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV ON THEATER, quiet and dark save for light coming through entry curtains. She spots usher's FLASHLIGHT on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CORALINE - she picks it up, clicks it on, and STEPS FORWARD. She sweeps the light beam around, apprehensive, then HEARS SOMETHING overhead. She aims flashlight up and startles a NEST OF BAT-DOGS - half Scotties/half bats. One bares his teeth and GROWLS. She clicks off the light and shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, one spotlight and footlights FADE UP on a huge, wrapped SALTWATER TAFFY. It hangs from ropes and sandbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cautiously climbs up onto the stage. A HUMAN-SIZED TAFFY THING - striped pale pink and green - can just be seen through the wrapper. She holds her TRIANGLE CANDY- WITH-HOLE to her eye. There is a BLUE-WHITE GLOW coming from inside the wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline PUNCHES A HOLE through the paper, steels herself, then reaches inside. She touches something sticky and cold and inhuman. Clenching her teeth, she grabs hold and pulls out two clasped-together COLD, TAFFY HANDS - Young Spink and Forcible's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her heart thumps. She PRIES the TAFFY HANDS open like scallop shells until a large PEARL-on-a-ring is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pearl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hands suddenly GRAB HER! She SCREAMS. Young Spink and Forcible, twisted together into one taffy monster, THRUST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thief!! Give it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline PULLS AWAY, STRETCHING the candy arm out across the stage! The taffy monster THRUSTS OUT another paired arm, and starts DRAGGING ITSELF TOWARDS CORALINE, ropes swaying on pulleys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison) You thief! Thief! Thief! Thief! Give it back! Thief! Give it back! Give it back! Thief! Stop thief! Thief! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, desperate, gets an idea. She clicks on her flashlight and aims it at the BAT-DOGS. They GROWL with annoyance, OPEN their wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taffy monster is GETTING CLOSER! Coraline hurls the flashlight at the bat-dogs and HITS THEM. Angered, they TAKE WING TO ATTACK HER - just like she planned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bat-dogs are closing on the left, the taffy monster on the right! She waits to the very last second, and then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAT-DOGS AND TAFFY MONSTER COLLIDE! Coraline's hand is released by the taffy hands, leaving her the PEARL. The bat-dogs and taffy monster - stuck together and still-as- stone - turn to dead, grey ash, as does the stage and theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PEARL in Coraline's hand PULSES BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry on, girl - her web is unwinding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline nods, sticks the pearl in her bag, and looks up towards the ceiling and beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORALINE'S MOVING POV, on lower ext stairs to UP ANGLE ON BALCONY. We hear haunting circus music in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Mr. B's Russian flag, TORN in places, waves in the air. The pale green moon is nearly HALF-ECLIPSED now with what is clearly the SHADOW OF A HUGE, DARK, BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON CORALINE as she climbs the last flight of stairs to Bobinsky's. She stops with a SHUDDER at the top. The flag has been replaced with the EMPTY COAT OF OTHER WYBIE gloves, pants and sneakers pinned on - hanging like old laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Wybie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a breath, leans out over the railing and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVIL WITCH ... I'M NOT SCARED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door behind her CREAKS open. Coraline shivers - she is definitely scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline steps into the apartment and carefully shuts the door. The cannons and Ferris wheel are dark and quiet; the circus tent glows dimly. Pale green moonlight shines in patches through holes in the roof. The corners and edges of the room are very dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OTHER BOBINSKY suddenly CRAWLS by the door behind her. Coraline whips around, on guard. He LOOMS UP past the cannons on her right, leaning towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, ga-LOO-boo-shka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are too many joints in his arms and legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His tall, crooked hat is pulled so low, and his collar so high, that his face is completely hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws out his arm towards her and the CIRCUS BALL from the mouse circus rolls from his sleeve to his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is dis vhat you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks through the hole of the triangle candy and sees an AMBER GLOW В­ the THIRD GHOST'S EYE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs for it, but he's too quick. He back-bends to all fours and SCUTTLES around her towards the back shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tink vinning game is goot ting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline holds up the triangle candy, scans the room for him. His voice sounds distorted now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll just go home and be bored and neglected...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE him twine up a post behind Coraline, crawl out on a beam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...same as alvays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SWINGS UPSIDE-DOWN from his ankles, his head stopping right by Coraline's. She whips around, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here vis us; vee vill listen to you and laugh vis you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DROPS to the floor on his head, then SLITHERS into the circus tent. Coraline does not want to follow him. But she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Mr. B is perched on a pile of MOLDY CHEESES in the center of the ring. He moves like all his bones are broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you stay here, you can have vhatever you vant, vsig-DA - alvays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline raises the triangle candy to her eye, sees the AMBER GLOW coming from inside his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small forms MOVE under the back of his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you don't understand. You're just a copy she made of the real Mr. B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (last breath) Not even that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline pulls off his hat. Instead of his head, a HUGE PALE RAT SITS THERE - holding the circus ball. It barks at her then DIVES DOWN the coat collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RATS leap from COAT SLEEVES and PANT LEGS, Coraline pulls back, HORRIFIED, as the clothes collapse, scanning around for the circus ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a rat bark behind her and she turns. The HUGE RAT - balanced on a wheel of cheese, circus ball in paws - TAUNTS HER, then RUNS THE CHEESE OUT THE DOOR! She GIVES CHASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OTHER RATS RACE behind the twin rows of cannons - the cheese wheel rat rolls through them, heading towards the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline CHARGES. The cannons, manned by rats, FIRE COTTON CANDY at her. She's HIT in the side, her leg, her ribs; she weaves and STUMBLES, the shots landing like punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PET DOOR - perfectly shaped for the rat on the wheel - appears in the front door as the rat approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline looks up to see the PET DOOR OPEN and the CHEESE WHEEL RAT HEADING THROUGH IT TO THE OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline takes her triangle candy stone and THROWS IT as hard as she can AT THE RAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whistling candy FLIES through the pet door towards the RAT, just outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RAT DUCKS, the CANDY MISSES, and the cheese-wheel rat ESCAPES down the stairs with the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, lurching forward, HOLLERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two waiting rats - tail tips tied - pull tails tight, and TRIP her. She CRASHES THROUGH THE DOOR AND--.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --OUT onto the balcony which TEARS AWAY FROM THE HOUSE with ATTACHED STAIRWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole rig, with Coraline on top, ROTATES as it collapses, THROWING CORALINE toward the front of the house when it HITS THE GROUND. She BLACKS OUT a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHEEZING for breath, Coraline pushes up on hands and knees and SCANS past the topiaries and poplars and white gravel driveway, looking for the cheese-wheel rat and circus ball. No cheese-wheel rat, no circus ball ghost eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, lit by a NARROWING BAND of pale green light, turns to look at the moon. It's nearly covered now by the DARK BUTTON SHADOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her HAND stings from a scrape. BLOOD trickles from her knee. She feels nothing but COLD LOSS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I've lost the game; I've lost everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sobs, hugs knees and face to chest. The band of light that illuminates her is narrowing to near-gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground, the HEAD of the cheese-wheel rat - CIRCUS BALL IN ITS TEETH - DROPS ON THE GROUND. Sawdust leaks from its neck. Band of light STOPS NARROWING, the eclipse paused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a familiar MEROWWW and Coraline looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across from her on the front yard, sits the BLACK CAT, licking his paws, rat's head and circus ball at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I mentioned that I don't like rats at the best of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline smiles, walks towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you might have said something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looked like you needed this one, however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bats the circus ball and it rolls to Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks it up , sticks it in her bag. Around her, the YARD, HOUSE, TREES, SHRUBS AND DRIVEWAY TURN ASHEN GRAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks towards house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm heading inside. I still have to find my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON MOON. The stalled eclipse STARTS AGAIN, and in one beat, the last sliver of green moon is FULLY BLACKED OUT. The EDGES of the button shadow start to FLAKE AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CORALINE WITH CAT. A strange insect thrumming has begun. What appear to be grey paint chips or bits of paper are falling. Confused, she looks up to see:.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge button shadow is EATEN TO NOTHING and then the SKY around it IS EATEN AS WELL, revealing dirty white light. The destruction TRAVELS from sky to the distant hills, the sound of a million, invisible locusts growing louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ANGLE ON CAT AND CORALINE. The cat hisses. Deeply alarmed, they look from one direction to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV out front yard. The destruction TRAVELS up the driveway, PULLS APART the poplars, and then UNRAVELS the topiary elephant and bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN ANGLE ON Coraline and cat, his TAIL TWITCHING. WE PULL BACK to find they are at the center of a RAPIDLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEW ANGLE on Coraline and cat as ground beneath their feet STARTS CRACKING, white light coming through. Cat makes a fearful sound, afraid for the first time in the movie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline holds out her arms to the trembling animal, her guardian angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat LEAPS and she catches him, then CARRIES HIM up the DISINTEGRATING porch steps to the front door. She gets through just in time, and SLAMS it shut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark and stable in here, with just some creaks and intermittent vibrations. A poisonous green light spills from the other living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline goes there, carrying the cat over her shoulder, past wallpaper that PEELS UP as she passes, to the room where she last heard the sound of her mother's finger on glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poisonous GREEN FIRE - LIKE SLEEPY SEA SNAKES - BURNS in the fireplace. The bug furniture looks grey now, their lights flickering as if short-circuited; legs and wings twitching uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline scans the walls, the ceiling, looking for a sign of her parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON CORALINE in foreground. She senses the Other Mother behind her, a creature who is no sort of Mother at all but a witch, a Beldam. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam is hunched on the sofa - her face hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're back....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice sounds dry and tired. She turns her face towards Coraline. It is a WHITE DEATH MASK, cracked and peeling - her true face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you brought vermin with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline shudders and steps back. The cat makes a fearful sound and digs his claws into her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I ... I brought a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam rises up 12 FEET TALL. She is WITHERED to the bone; with plate-like shoulders and hips; her bustle now an arachnid's tail section. Her true form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches her long, sharp FINGERS MADE OF NEEDLES to Coraline's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline works hard to not show how freaked out she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, you have a very funny way of showing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam smiles, turns away, then back, her hand outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?     Where are they - the ghost eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline pulls out the three spheres from her bag and starts to hand them over. But she catches herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We aren't finished yet, are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam looks daggers, then smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I suppose not. After all, you still need to find your old parents, don't you? Too bad you won't have this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She produces the TRIANGLE CANDY that Coraline lost and FLINGS it into the green fire. The Beldam laughs while the MAGIC BURNS out of the candy with sparks and pops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CORALINE. The third ghost eye PULSES WITH AMBER LIGHT in her hand. Coraline turns away, so the witch won't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be clever, miss; even if you win she'll never let you go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline looks towards the locked little door behind the armoire bug and understands: she's got to get the Beldam to unlock it! She furrows her brow as an idea comes to her then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to the witch and in the most confident tone she can muster, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already know where you've hidden them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam turns from the fire, both concerned and sceptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... produce them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline points to the little door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're behind that door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam leans close, knowing Coraline is wrong, and speaks very quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they are, are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile creeps onto her terrible face. And she STARTS TOWARDS THE LITTLE DOOR, moving in an odd, laboring way, as if she had four legs instead of two. She signals the armoire bug to stand aside, her back to Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline hears the soft chirp of her mother's finger on wet glass! Looks around, desperate - where is it coming from?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat's ears twitch and focus, and then he SEES SOMETHING on the mantel!. He whispers to Coraline --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and JUMPS to land beside the DETROIT ZOO SNOW-GLOBE - OPAQUE WITH FROST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. ON SNOW-GLOBE. With a SOFT-CHIRP, a section of glass is WIPED CLEAR from inside by a TINY FOREARM - and we see the tiny, cold figures that are CORALINE'S TRAPPED PARENTS! Coraline's heart races. She purposely stays back from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.   Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BELDAM, by little door. Oblivious to Coraline's discovery, she COUGHS up the KEY into her hand. She turns to Coraline, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.   Open it. They'll be there, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam stoops to push the key into the lock, turns it, leaves the key in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grins at Coraline and speaks in a low, sing-song voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
