dialogues.text: You're wrong, Coraline!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the little door, revealing the empty, spider- web tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CORALINE, who glances from the open door to the cat - obscured on the mantel - and back to the Beldam. She's thinking very hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They aren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her hands: one holds box with Coraline's BLACK BUTTON EYES, the other a THREADED NEEDLE. Triumphant, the Beldam softly gloats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're going to stay here forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline strikes a warrior's pose, and, summons all the fury she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GRABS THE CAT off the mantel and RAISES HIM OVER HER HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she HURLS THE CAT at the Beldam. The YOWLING ANIMAL - face shocked with surprise - SAILS through the air and lands RIGHT ON THE ASTONISHED WITCH'S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREAKED-OUT, the cat DIGS in his CLAWS AND BITES the shrieking Beldam, who STAGGERS to one side of the little door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline GRABS the SNOW GLOBE with her parents inside, stows it in her bag, and moves out to approach the door from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam FLAILS WILDLY at the cat. The cat HOWLS LIKE A BANSHEE, RAISES HIS CLAWS, and - quick as you can - TWO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON CAT as he's thrown on armoire bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BELDAM, hands covering her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hands pull away to show EMPTY, FLAT SOCKETS and TORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You horrible cheating girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She furiously STOMPS the floor which FLIES UP in a spiral of floorboards that drive Coraline to the room's center. A huge WEB TRAP LIES BENEATH THE FLOOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The web trap STRETCHES DOWN into a FIFTY FOOT DEEP PIT. There is nothing beyond but PALE NOTHINGNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat scrambles along the tops of falling furniture straight to the little door and disappears into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline falls the very bottom of the web.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty feet above, the Beldam LAUGHS MANIACALLY and LEAPS DOWN like a huge, flying spider!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline manages to pull herself to the outside of the trap JUST AS THE BELDAM LANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witch - furious her prey has escaped - spins around, grasping blindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noo!! Where are you? You selfish brat!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, nearing the top, looks up and spots the LITTLE DOOR, still in the corner wall of the Other Living Room. She goes to climb back inside the web, when her bag GETS CAUGHT on a barb. She pulls and pulls until it breaks free, sending a STRONG VIBRATION DOWN THE SPIRALING WEB TO THE VERY SENSITIVE HAND OF THE BELDAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hahahaha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beldam smiles - she knows where her prey is now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline makes it to the little door, but the BELDAM IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU ... DARE ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline SCRAMBLES through the door, KEY IN HAND, and grabs the door's handle. Before she can shut it, the BELDAM'S HEAD THRUSTS INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... DISOBEY YOUR MOTHER                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline KICKS HER IN THE FACE, knocking her back. The cat takes off down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline nearly shuts the door, when NEEDLE FINGERS GRAB HOLD THROUGH THE CRACK. The door STARTS TO PULL OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLEASE...SHUT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghost children's FLUTTERY, DISMEMBERED HANDS FLY OUT FROM HER BAG and GRAB HOLD OF CORALINE'S HANDS that grip the door's handle. And her STRENGTH IS QUADRUPLED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door STARTS TO SHUT. The Beldam SNATCHES DESPERATELY at Coraline, reaching through the closing gap with one thin claw. There's a final moment of resistance - the Beldam's wire-thin wrist caught in the door - and then SNAP! The DOOR SHUTS, and the Beldam's hand drops to the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SCREECHES like a metal rake on pavement!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline just manages to lock the door in the dark when it is POUNDED from the other side, green light coming through cracks! She takes off down the tunnel, stooped down, as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pounding grows more insistent, green light flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T LEAVE ME! DON'T LEAVE ME!!! I'LL DIE WITHOUT YOU!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the tunnel behind coraline STARTS TO GROW SHORTER, like a collapsing accordion and the pounding far door with the blind, one-handed Beldam on the other side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, DAYLIGHT APPEARS, and then the LITTLE DOOR TO THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline FLINGS HERSELF through the doorway, SHUTS AND LOCKS THE DOOR and BRACES HERSELF AGAINST IT. A split- second later, the OTHER WORLD DOOR CATCHES UP WITH A CRASH! Coraline is THROWN BACK. But the real-world door and lock, hold. It's over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline lies on her back, as beat-up and tired as she's ever been, GULPING in breaths of air till her heart slows a little. The room is brightly lit by sunlight, the first since she moved here, and the sky out the windows is blue with white clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, remembering, and turns to her bag with the ghost eyes and snow globe with her parents inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens it up, and searches, shoving aside ghost eyes and garden shears. But the snow globe is GONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets on all fours, starts searching the floor. Her hand hits a small PUDDLE by the fireplace, with tiny bits of BLUE SNOW. A drip plops down, then another. She looks up to the mantel and spots the MISSING SNOW GLOBE. She stands up and finds that it's BROKEN OPEN, and neither her parents or the fountain bears are inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last of the snowy liquid drains from the globe, Coraline's face clouds with confusion and fear: What does this mean and where are her parents? Then her WONDERFULLY REAL MOTHER calls to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline? We're home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her TRUE PARENTS enter the room from the hallway, a dusting of snow on their shoulders and hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Dad! I missed you so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline runs to her parents and throws her arms around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. ON CORALINE. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel notices the broken snow globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, you broke my favorite snow globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't break it. It must've broke when you escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom spots her bloody knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And cut your knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie crouches low, clutching his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, I asked you to count all the windows, not put your knee through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUT-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel tells her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, get yourself cleaned up,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we're going out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta lot to celebrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, confused, takes a stab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about... your garden catalog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her parents turn to leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But look at the snow on your clothes...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the snow melts without a trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gotten into you, Coraline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her parents walk off. Coraline shrugs her shoulders and looks back to the broken snow globe on the mantel. She cocks her head, deeply puzzled, then leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VW is parked out front, its interior light fading as light in Coraline's bedroom window switches on. We HEAR Charlie make a strangled sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sits in bed -- pajamas washed and PATCHED, wounds-dressed, hair shining. The KEY hangs from a string around her neck. A gibbous moon shines in the clear night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie wrestles with a blue stuffed-toy squid like it's an alien face-hugger then, FEIGNING DEATH, falls on the bed. Coraline LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, gonna order the tulips?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens one eye, pretends he's never heard about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the garden party!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up and kids her, tickling her face with the squid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Mom, arranging things on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Mom. Invitations? Don't forget the invitations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother nods, points up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Bobinsky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. B's not drunk, Mom, he's just...eccentric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie LAUGHS. He bends down to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he steps away, Mel slips a slim box under the covers next to her daughter. She gives Coraline a "told you so" look, and she and Charlie leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sits up excitedly and opens the box - it's the GREEN AND ORANGE GLOVES she'd wanted! She pulls one on to admire when the BLACK CAT appears outside her window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to the window, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His expression says yes, he's still mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry I threw you at her - the Other Mother? В­ it was all I could think of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat's angry expression softens. He rests his head on her hand, licking her fingers and purrs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline exhales with relief then picks him up and carries him over to her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her collecting bag and takes out the large PEARL, the CIRCUS BALL, and the GREY STICKSHIFT KNOB. She holds them out to the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time, don't you? To set them free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat nods. She puts the ghost eyes under her pillow and gently lays down, the cat lying beside her. The two of them close their eyes, and in no time at all, they doze off to sleep. WE SLOWLY TILT UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAGIC ART SKY animates subtly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAM TILT DOWN ON Coraline, studying sky, her back to us. From behind CAM, CHIMES sound and GOLD LIGHT begins to shine on her. She turns toward us, shielding her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline's eyes adjust to the brightness to see the THREE GHOST CHILDREN, now transformed into GOLDEN ANGELS; EYES RESTORED, small fluttering WINGS ON THEIR BACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fine, fine thing you did for us, miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad it's finally over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADOW crosses the faces of the three children. They gather around Coraline and bow their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is over and done with ... for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about...me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tall girl ghost shifts uncomfortably, then BLURTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in terrible danger, girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline is stunned and gestures for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how?   I locked the door!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the key, miss, there's only one and the Beldam will find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KEY ON THE STRING around Coraline's neck floats out in front of Coraline. She grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three ghost children all embrace Coraline tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tain't all bad, miss. Thou art alive ... thou art still ... living...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to swirl around her, spinning faster and faster. Coraline starts to turn and then she --

dialogues.speaker: -- ROLLS HERSELF AWAKE IN HER OWN BED. FAST PULL BACK
dialogues.text: above her to find covers thrown off and the CAT awake by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline lifts up her pillow and GASPS - the GHOST EYES ARE IN PIECES like hatched bird eggs. She takes out the key on its string and explains to the cat, her voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I've gotta hide this somewhere, s- somewhere she can never ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat doesn't like the sound of this. Coraline grabs her blanket and heads to her door. But the cat leaps down and blocks her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outta my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sidesteps the cat and leaves her room. The cat glares after her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline trots down the stairs and purposefully heads down the hall. She passes the LIVING ROOM and exits frame. CAMERA stays on living room, where, on the LITTLE DOOR in the corner wall, SHADOWS and LIGHT start to MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baseboard is PUSHED ASIDE. Through the narrow gap at the door's bottom, the DISMEMBERED HAND OF THE BELDAM CRAWLS OUT. It scrambles out of frame in the direction of Coraline!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline moves briskly, the house below, GRIPPING THE KEY that's tied round her neck. DARK, ROPEY CLOUDS reach like fingers across the gibbous moon. Coraline sings her father's nonsense song, her voice hardly trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.... my twitchy witchy girl, I think you are so nice ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves down past the old fruit trees, now covered with BRIGHT SPRING BLOSSOMS that fall gently like snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I give you bowls of porridge And I give you bowls of ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE ON Coraline, moving away. The BELDAM'S HAND drops into frame and CREEP-CRAWLS after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you lots of kisses, And I give you lots of hugs ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline jams the SAME DEAD BRANCH Wybie used under the well's cover, lining it up over the SAME FULCRUM ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But I never give you sandwiches With grease and worms and mung beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circling around behind the BIG STUMP, the HAND SCAMPERS behind one rock to a bush to a tree, coming closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline manages to lever the well's cover off to one side, leaving the WHOLE WELL OPEN. Huffing and sweating, she wipes her brow, then takes the key string that's around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand, SEEING what is about to happen, RACES TOWARDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline lifts string and key, not quite over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand JUMPS onto the big stump and SPRINGS through the air to GRAB THE KEY and PULL CORALINE TO THE GROUND!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline makes a CHOKED SCREAM, her fingers caught between the key string and her neck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HAND wants to DRAG HER BACK TO THE HOUSE and the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLINDING HEADLIGHT hits HAND and CORALINE; an AIR HORN SOUNDS; and WYBIE LOVAT - hollering a BATTLE CRY all his own - comes SPEEDING DOWN THE BLUFF on his whining electric bike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YAHHHHH!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie GUNS the throttle, and, leaning out, GRABS the confused HAND with his slug tongs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He CIRCLES AROUND and HEADS TOWARDS THE WELL, readying to throw the hand in. But the HAND GETS FREE, and GRABS his handlebars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUT OF CONTROL, Wybie's bike HITS A ROCK, and WYBIE AND HAND ARE THROWN RIGHT DOWN THE WELL. HOLLERING, he just manages to hang on with one hand! The Beldam's hand, caught on Wybie's coattail, SCRAMBLES UP his body and face and onto the well's edge where it STABS AT HIS FINGERS to make him fall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, choking, rises to her feet. She grabs her BLANKET and - in the still-blazing headlight of the crashed bike - she RUNS UP and THROWS IT OVER THE HAND. It fights like crazy as Coraline wrestles to control it. The hand STABS THROUGH THE BLANKET and SHAKES IT OFF. It crouches to attack her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then WYBIE IS BACK, pumped with adrenaline, a BIG ROCK raised over his head! He HURLS IT DOWN ON THE LEAPING HAND! And it BREAKS into TWENTY LIFELESS NEEDLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie struggles to catch his breath. Coraline - breathing hard - removes the key and string from around her sore neck. She pulls up the corners of her blanket - with the needles on it - around the rock, and ties it all together with the string. The key is left attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two friends carry the heavy package to the well and DROP IT DOWN THE HOLE. By the light of a stray moonbeam, they watch and listen until it makes a muffled splash in the dark water at the bottom. They slide the well cover in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still catching his breath, Wybie stands, holding his injured hand, its glove ripped by the Beldam's claw. He looks over at Coraline as the scene brightens a little with moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I'm really sorry I didn't believe you about all this ... evil stuff, Coraline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, shoulders rising as she catches her breath, stands and smiles: he called her by real name for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over, and takes out an old B&W photo from hi jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-well, Gramma showed me this picture, after I called you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON PHOTO: two light-skinned black girls - dressed in old-fashioned clothing - stand in front of the Pink Palace, before it was divided into apartments. One looks just like the sweet ghost girl, and holds the DOLL WITH BUTTON EYES, which looks just like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her and her sister, before she disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON WYBIE AND CORALINE. Behind them, blossoms fall like snow in the orchard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sweet ghost girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wybie's grandmother, loud and worried, calls from the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyborne!   Come home!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his grandmother) Oh, man...what am I going to tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up from the photo and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bring her by the house tomorrow.      We can tell her together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We...we can??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm glad you decided to stalk me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Wybie a playful punch on the arm and LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLACK CAT jumps up on the TREE STUMP and MEROWWS. Coraline smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TILT UP to the sky and see the last ropey clouds - like two clawed hands - clear away from the bright gibbous moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One WHITE BALLOON floats against a blue sky with puffy, white clouds. WE TILT DOWN past more balloons to a TABLE OF REFRESHMENTS, set up by the front gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline picks up a TRAY OF DRINKS and heads out to her hard-working GUESTS, all wearing garden gloves and showing signs of having helped plant about TWO HUNDRED RED TULIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPINK AND FORCIBLE, along with their DOGS, are set up at a table below the steps. Empty plant cartons are stacked nearby along with some garden tools and empty bags of peat moss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for helping me, Miss Spink, Miss Forcible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining to see) Oh, look April - Pink Ladies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's just lemonade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline hands them the beverages, then nods towards the GREY DOG digging in the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Angus doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Spink sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, much better, dear... But he can't duck his wings forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline heads up the steps to find her PARENTS dumping a heavy bag of PEAT MOSS around the dead-looking tree in the stone circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes a burp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie BURPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, excu-say-moi, but that pizza was delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold drinks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie nods, grabs them for Mel and Wybie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, Coraline. I really hate dirt, but the tulips look nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline, delighted, moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline comes upon Bobinsky in the bottom of the drained fish pond. He's stealthily PULLING just-planted tulips from the dirt there, and putting BEETS in their place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling beets) Ooo, dret nican...neit, neit...da, da, dat iz possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline CLEARS HER THROAT to get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are the meeshkas, Mr. B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised and looking very guilty, he tries to cover up his activities. She smiles and hands him a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dey tell me that   you - are saviour, Caroline. And --   soon as dey are ready -- dey vish to give   special tenks-you performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drains his glass of lemonade. A familiar voice is heard approaching. Coraline turns and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyborne, I know where I'm going--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Wybie and his GRANDMOTHER as they walk through the garden gates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I grew up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coraline sees them and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Ms. Lovat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old lady looks up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Coraline Jones -- I've got so much to tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (background dialog) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (background dialog) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (background dialog) Ooo, do you want to pop a little gin in it dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (background dialog) Of course!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS UP from the GARDEN, FLIES OVER THE HOUSE and BOOMS DOWN to the PINK PALACE APARTMENTS SIGN out front. On top of the sign sits the black cat, who looks right into camera, blinks, then walks behind the thin post that holds the sign and DISAPPEARS.
